law.catch_line: License for speech-language pathology assistant -- Requirements for licensure -- Supervision requirements.

text.section:
To be eligible for licensure by the board as a speech-language pathology assistant, the applicant shall meet the following requirements:
A baccalaureate degree in the area of speech-language pathology as defined by administrative regulation;
Completion of postgraduate professional experience deemed appropriate by the board by administrative regulation; and
List on the application the name of the appropriately qualified supervisor who has agreed to provide supervision as set forth by the board by administrative regulation.

law.history: Amended 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 375, sec. 7, effective July 14, 2000. -- Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 219, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1996. -- Created 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 32, sec. 4, effective July 15, 1994.
